intro: Dalechampia regnellii, commonly known as the white dalechampia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, showy inflorescences. The plant produces small, greenish flowers surrounded by fleshy, spiny structures called cyathia. Its leaves are typically alternate, ovate, and have a rough texture. Dalechampia regnellii thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas.
